messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re:Digest Number 859/My Intro
messages.msgSnippet: I didnt realize the hailstorm my intro would set off. I hope no one takes offense but thats all it was, an intro.  Ive enjoyed finding out there are other
messages.messageBody:
I didnt realize the hailstorm my intro would set off.
I hope no one takes offense but thats all it was, an
intro. Ive enjoyed finding out there are other
Traditional homeschooling moms out there and hope to
be able to share more with them in the future.

Robin, Don't worry. These things tend to take on a life of their own. It can
be a good thing because we can all learn from whatever direction it goes.
Welcome again.

--Valerie in Tacoma

messages.subject: Re:Digest Number 859/My Intro
messages.msgSnippet: ~What we learned in the original post (which I don t have and which had another subject line) was a little boy was called a satan worshipper for being pagan.
messages.messageBody:
~What we learned in the original post (which I don't
have and which had another subject line) was a little
boy was called a satan worshipper for being pagan.
Was he in school? Then perhaps our own
proper/allowable
response was "Take him out and homeschool him to avoid
this in the future."~

Im sorry but were not Pagan, were Cherokee and follow
the teachings of our ancestors. Theres a big
difference.

Yes he was in school and I pulled him for that reason.
I wasnt going to allow him to be subjugated to
teachers telling him he was wrong about his own
history.

I didnt realize the hailstorm my intro would set off.
I hope no one takes offense but thats all it was, an
intro. Ive enjoyed finding out there are other
Traditional homeschooling moms out there and hope to
be able to share more with them in the future.

__________________________________________________
